name: Horizontal Extensions
Tips: Bend your knees slightly.

name: Horizontal Extensions
Tips: Space the band ends wider apart to increase resistance.

name: Horizontal Extensions
Tips: Keep upper arms stationary to isolate triceps.

name: Lat-Band Pullown
Tips: Relax your arms and lead with elbows. Keep the rest of your body motionless.

name: Lat-Band Pullown
Tips: A close grip will engage rhomboid muscles and an underhand grip will also engage biceps.

name: Lat-Band Pullown
Tips: A high post may allow you to stand where a low post may require you to sit, kneel, or take a staggered stance with one foot in front of the other.

name: Lat-Band Pullown
Tips: Change your approach periodically for a well-rounded workout.

name: Seated Band Rows
Tips: Don't let your arms and shoulders do all the work.

name: Seated Band Rows
Tips: Keep your torso still, knees slightly bent, chest out and back straight.

name: Seated Band Rows
Tips: Tighten your abs and try not to rock back and forth.

name: Bent Over Band-Rows
Tips: Keep abs tight and upper body still.

name: Bent Over Band-Rows
Tips: Lift your chest to maintain the natural arch in your back.

name: Bent Over Band-Rows
Tips: Pull hands toward stomach to engage lower lats. Pull hands in higher toward chest to engage upper lats.

name: Bent Over Band-Rows
Tips: Experiment with different grip options and A.P. heights.

name: Straight Arm Pulldowns
Tips: Keep shoulder blades drawn tightly together, elbows slightly bent in a fixed position and wrists straight.

name: Straight Arm Pulldowns
Tips: Be creative with your positioning- stand on a platform, kneel, sit or bend over at the waist to adjust your height. Lower yourself to raise the resistance.

name: Straight Arm Pulldowns
Tips: Take a small step forward or backward to modify your 'pulldown'.

name: Reverse Flyes
Tips: Focus on pinching your shoulder blades together.

name: Reverse Flyes
Tips: Keep elbows fixed in a slightly bent position and arms elevated at the same height.

name: Deadlift
Tips: All body movement should originate by bending at the hips.

name: Deadlift
Tips: Keeps abs tight to prevent strain on lower back.

name: Deadlift
Tips: Hips, lower back and abs should work together like a crane that comfortably pulls you up and lowers you into place.

name: Deadlift
Tips: Use your arms as hooks to hold the band or bar without assisting in the lift.

name: Deadlift
Tips: Keep your back straight and knees slightly bent.

name: Kickbacks
Tips: Keep elbows fixed by your side to engage triceps, avoiding help from deltoids.

name: Kickbacks
Tips: Keep feet close together with torso still and back straight for balance.

name: Kickbacks
Tips: Take a step back to raise resistance.

name: Tricep Pushdown
Tips: Resist the urge to put any body weight into the pushdown.

name: Tricep Pushdown
Tips: Position your feet in a staggered stance or side-byside.

name: Tricep Pushdown
Tips: Lower yourself to raise the resistance.

name: Dips
Tips: Raise your body in one vertical line during the ascent and descent.

name: Dips
Tips: Keep your back as close as possible to the chair behind you.

name: Dips
Tips: Aside from arms, keep the rest of your body motionless.

name: Dips
Tips: Do not go much lower after elbows reach a 90° angle to avoid injury.

name: Animals
Tips: Don't let your back or chest compensate -- use your triceps!

name: Animals
Tips: This is a difficult lift, so start with a low resistance, increasing gradually as you maintain proper form.

name: Close Grip Push-Up Press
Tips: Point toes down to help maintain your balance.

name: Close Grip Push-Up Press
Tips: Remove the band to lower resistance.

name: Lateral Extension
Tips: Puff your chest out to isolate triceps.

name: Lateral Extension
Tips: Experiment by pushing the band down at different angles from your body.

name: Lateral Extension
Tips: If you feel pain in your shoulders, bring your elbows more toward the front of your torso.

name: Vertical Extensions
Tips: Keep upper arms motionless beside your head to isolate triceps.

name: Vertical Extensions
Tips: Keep your back straight, abs tight and knees slightly bent.

name: Overhead Extensions
Tips: Keep your upper arms and torso completely motionless.

name: Overhead Extensions
Tips: The farther you lean forward, the more tension you will feel in your upper back.

name: Overhead Extensions
Tips: Step forward or adjust A.P. height to alter resistance.

name: Wrapped Shoulder Extension
Tips: Make sure the band is twisted over, forming an X behind you to avoid slippage.

name: Wrapped Shoulder Extension
Tips: Keep upper arms still.

name: Wrapped Shoulder Extension
Tips: Wear a protective layer of clothing to prevent the band from irritating your skin.

name: Resisted Kicks
Tips: Keep your leg straight and push from ankle.

name: Resisted Kicks
Tips: Touch any stationary object for balance.

name: Resisted Kicks
Tips: Stand tall on your supporting leg.

name: Military Press
Tips: Keep back straight and abs tight to avoid lower back strain.

name: Military Press
Tips: Take a wider stance or loop the bands to raise resistance.

name: Military Press
Tips: Use a bar to balance and lower overall resistance.

name: Front Raises
Tips: Keep elbows slightly bent in a fixed position.

name: Front Raises
Tips: Do not rock your torso back and forth.

name: Front Raises
Tips: Maintain at least minimal resistance on both bands at all times.

name: Lateral Raises
Tips: Keep elbows slightly bent in a fixed position.

name: Lateral Raises
Tips: Do not rock your torso back and forth.

name: Lateral Raises
Tips: Maintain at least minimal resistance on both bands at all times.

name: Upright Rows
Tips: Lead with your elbows as you lift.

name: Upright Rows
Tips: Your back and trap muscles will naturally want to assist your deltoids.

name: Upright Rows
Tips: This should be a smooth motion without any jerking

name: Upright Rows
Tips: Spread feet apart or loop band to raise resistance.

name: Cableband Laterals
Tips: Maintain elbows fixed in a slightly bent position.

name: Cableband Laterals
Tips: Keep your arm parallel to the ground.

name: Cableband Laterals
Tips: Angle yourself toward or away from A.P. to modify resistance.

name: Cableband Laterals
Tips: Take a wider stance to maintain balance.

name: Skiers
Tips: Maintain arms as straight as possible to direct the tension to your shoulders instead of triceps.

name: Skiers
Tips: Roll your shoulders forward to engage rear deltoids.

name: Isolation Pulls
Tips: Keep your elbow planted by your side and your forearm parallel to the ground.

name: Isolation Pulls
Tips: Hold your upper arm in place with the other hand to limit movement.

name: Shrugs
Tips: Maintain arms as straight and keep your back straight, abs tight and knees slightly bent.

name: Shrugs
Tips: Pull your shoulders up toward your ears.

name: Shrugs
Tips: Squeeze your shoulders together behind you as you raise them up. Don't roll them forwards or backwards at the top.

name: Leg Liberator
Tips: Keep your shoulders pinned to the floor.

name: Leg Liberator
Tips: Repeat with right leg when finished.

name: Leg Liberator
Tips: Maintain stability in your hips, keep your leg straight, and keep your back flat on the floor.

name: Back Lubricator
Tips: Stretch your hamstrings by keeping arms and back straight and shifting body weight to your heels.

name: Quad-lity
Tips: Breathe regularly as you slowly relieve the stiffness and relax your quadriceps.

name: Wicked Chicken Wing
Tips: If you pull the band up or down, you should feel a stretch in your shoulders or triceps, respectively.

name: Crossband Lateral Curls
Tips: Keep abs tight and elbows stationary by your side.

name: Crossband Lateral Curls
Tips: Force your arms outward laterally while maintaining constant tension in biceps.

name: Crossband Lateral Curls
Tips: You may feel some resistance in your shoulders.

name: Bandbell Curls
Tips: Position bands under toes.

name: Bandbell Curls
Tips: Refrain from arching your back or swaying body forwards or backwards.

name: Bandbell Curls
Tips: Experiment by moving hands closer and farther apart.

name: Reverse Curls
Tips: Keep wrists straight, shoulders down and elbows by your side.

name: Reverse Curls
Tips: If seated, keep legs straight.

name: Reverse Curls
Tips: Use a bar to lower the resistance and balance the weight distribution.

name: Reverse Curls
Tips: To raise the resistance, spread feet farther apart or loop the band.

name: Cableband Curls
Tips: Keep your upper arms stationary.

name: Cableband Curls
Tips: Take a step back to raise resistance.

name: Cableband Curls
Tips: Alter the A.P. height for a different feel.

name: Cableband Curls
Tips: If using two posts, the distance between posts can vary widely according to availability (see video for ideas).

name: Squats
Tips: Keep feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart with all body weight on heels.

name: Squats
Tips: You should feel tension in thighs and buttocks, not the knees or back.

name: Squats
Tips: Drop your buttocks lower for an added challenge.

name: Squats
Tips: Knees should not extend past your toes. If they do, you are leaning too far forward.

name: Squats
Tips: Arch your back slightly inward and pinch your shoulder blades together.

name: Squats
Tips: Point your toes outward to engage inner thigh muscles, and point toes inward to engage outer thighs.

name: Squats
Tips: Focus eyes on a specific point in front of you to help your balance.

name: Leg Press
Tips: Maintain constant tension on the bands.

name: Leg Press
Tips: Loop the bands around your feet to raise the resistance.

name: Leg Press
Tips: Unite bands with a clip or twist them in the middle to minimize the friction against your legs.

name: Leg Extensions
Tips: Keep knee elevated so that your foot never touches the ground.

name: Leg Extensions
Tips: Position chair farther from A.P. to increase resistance.

name: Leg Extensions
Tips: Place a rolled-up towel or pillow under your thigh to prop up your leg.

name: Good Mornings
Tips: The sensation should be like having a hinge in your hips with no movement occurring below the hips (same as DEADLIFTS,http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XbmlMh4PB6I).

name: Good Mornings
Tips: Keep legs and back straight with shoulder blades locked together.

name: Good Mornings
Tips: Ascend and descend slowly for greater control.

name: Good Mornings
Tips: Drop torso lower for an additional challenge.

name: Straight Leg Deadlift
Tips: Tighten your abs and squeeze your glutes.

name: Straight Leg Deadlift
Tips: Keep legs straight to direct resistance to hamstrings instead of lower back.

name: Straight Leg Deadlift
Tips: Lock shoulder blades together to help straighten your back.

name: Straight Leg Deadlift
Tips: See DEADLIFT(http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XbmlMh4PB6I) in the BACK section(http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL9F4ED54F06BF542C) for other helpful hints.

name: Leg Curls
Tips: Raise the A.P. height to engage your lower hamstrings.

name: Leg Curls
Tips: Keep thighs flexed and bands taut so that hamstrings are never completely resting.

name: Calf Raises
Tips: Keep your entire body still.

name: Calf Raises
Tips: Stabilize bands under toes to secure them in place.

name: Calf Raises
Tips: Balance yourself by touching any stationary object.

name: Calf Raises
Tips: Extend your heels farther off the edge for a more challenging exercise.

name: Calf Raises
Tips: Point toes inward or outward and position feet closer or further apart to engage all areas of calf muscles.

name: Hip Abductor/Adductor
Tips: Squeeze hips while slowly spreading and closing legs.

name: Hip Abductor/Adductor
Tips: Distance feet farther apart, position feet in closer toward your body, or prop feet up on any object to shift the resistance.

name: Hip Abductor/Adductor
Tips: Loop bands around feet to raise resistance.

name: Lunges
Tips: At the bottom of the LUNGE, your front knee should be bent so that it blocks your line of vision to your front foot, but is not bent past your foot.

name: Lunges
Tips: Your lead foot should stay flat on the ground until lifted back up to the rear foot.

name: Lunges
Tips: Longer strides target glutes, shorter strides target quads.

name: Lunges
Tips: Engage hamstrings by keeping the trailing leg as straight as possible as you go down.

name: Lunges
Tips: LUNGE slowly to intensify the workout.

name: Hammer Curls
Tips: Keep abs tight and wrists straight.

name: Hammer Curls
Tips: Maintain constant tension on both bands, even while one arm is resting.

name: Hammer Curls
Tips: Slowly lift and lower each arm to prevent momentum from swinging your arms upward

name: Alternate Bandbell Curls
Tips: Position bands under toes.

name: Alternate Bandbell Curls
Tips: Refrain from arching your back or swaying body forwards or backwards.

name: Alternate Bandbell Curls
Tips: Experiment by moving hands closer and farther apart.

name: Concentration Curls
Tips: Do not bend your wrist for assistance.

name: Concentration Curls
Tips: If you don't feel tension in biceps, try re-angling chair or adjusting A.P. height.

name: Concentration Curls
Tips: Keep elbow firmly planted on thigh.

name: Incline Bench Press
Tips: Concentrate on remaining within a constant line of maximum resistance.

name: Incline Bench Press
Tips: Take a step forward away from the A.P. to increase resistance.

name: Incline Bench Press
Tips: Keep the rest of your body still by restricting all movement to chest and arms.

name: Incline Bench Press
Tips: Finish set with 2-5 negative reps.

name: Decline Bench Press
Tips: Keep pectoral muscles tight and forearms parallel to the band throughout lift.

name: Decline Bench Press
Tips: Do not arch your back.

name: Decline Bench Press
Tips: Finish sets with negative reps.

name: Push Up Press
Tips: Keep body as straight as possible throughout the exercise (including head).

name: Push Up Press
Tips: Do not lock arms out at the top to avoid stress on elbows.

name: Push Up Press
Tips: Do negative reps by slowing down the regression and speeding up the push-up to exhaust chest and back muscles.

name: Flyes
Tips: Keep elbows slightly bent in a fixed position.

name: Flyes
Tips: Imagine trying to pop a pingpong ball between your pecs.

name: Flyes
Tips: Puff chest out slightly to stretch pecs.

name: Flyes
Tips: Hold rep at the point of maximum resistance for a challenge (Static Contraction Training).

name: Pull Over
Tips: Squeeze pecs during descent to avoid compensation from back and shoulder muscles.

name: Pull Over
Tips: Maintain arms in a fixed, bent position.

name: Pull Over
Tips: Move hands closer together for a challenge.

name: Pull Over
Tips: You can bend your knees,squat down, or sit for comfort but keep your back straight.

name: Flat Bench Press
Tips: Start with elbows out 90° from your body and keep back straight.

name: Flat Bench Press
Tips: Keep arms tucked by your sides to engage triceps and inner chest, keep arms farther from your body to engage deltoids and outer chest (use a wide or narrow grip).

name: Flat Bench Press
Tips: Finish with 2-5 negative reps by slowing the regression to starting point to fully exhaust pectoral muscles.

name: Twist
Tips: Keep back straight and abs tight.

name: Twist
Tips: Move slowly to make sure that momentum does not guide you. Let your obliques do the work.

name: Woodchopper
Tips: Center your body weight over your feet and your head over your shoulders.

name: Woodchopper
Tips: Rotate shoulders and hips together as a unit with abs.

name: Side Bridge
Tips: Count how many seconds you can hold this pose to measure progress.

name: Raise
Tips: Keep back flat on the floor.

name: Raise
Tips: Keep abs tight to avoid lower back pain.

name: Raise
Tips: If uncomfortable, place hands under glutes to support your torso.

name: Roll
Tips: Squeeze your abs throughout the movement for maximum contraction.

name: Roll
Tips: Keep knees bent at the same angle during your set.

name: Roll
Tips: For a challenging addition, after bringing knees to shoulders, raise your legs straight up in the air, hold briefly while balancing yourself on your shoulders and upper back.

name: Hyperextension
Tips: Keep your arms and back straight with abs firmly contracted.

name: Hyperextension
Tips: Use bar or handgrips to ease the pressure on your hands.

name: Aligner
Tips: Keep abs tight and maintain good posture as the bands draw your shoulders back and open your chest.

name: Aligner
Tips: Wear a thick shirt or protective layer to prevent irritation.

name: Crunch
Tips: You don't need to lift your entire back off the ground to feel the burn, just get your shoulder blades about an inch or two (2-5 cm) off the ground.

name: Crunch
Tips: Give an extra squeeze at the top for a total contraction before slowly lowering back to starting position.

name: Crunch
Tips: Perform the descent portion of the rep just as slowly and deliberate as the ascent.

name: Crunch
Tips: Avoid pulling your head forward with your hands or using your back to propel yourself forward.

name: Squeeze
Tips: Keep your back straight as you lower your head toward the floor.

name: Squeeze
Tips: Avoid pulling the band down with your arms.

name: Squeeze
Tips: Squeeze your abs at the bottom before ascending back to starting position.
